note.p: Career: Secretary and Counsellor to Louis XIV; a Huguenot, he tried to promote a non-sectarian translation of the Bible into French; sent three rare manuscripts to Oxford University (1675); knowing that the Edict of Nantes would soon be revoked, he sold his considerable library and took refuge in England (1681); naturalised British (1687); Keeper of the King's Library to Charles II and James II
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Foster; Shaw LD; Agnew
References: M Greenwood, 'The First Life Table' in NR 1938 vol 1 pp 70-72
